p:
Another contribution to the remarkable improvement in TE performance at high temperatures results from the extremely low lattice part ( κ L = 0.1 WK −1m −1 for the sample x = 0.15), as the highest power factors for the samples, which range from 7.2 μW/cm-K 2 to 8.3 μW/cm-K 2 around 814 K, are almost the same (see Fig. S5). The low lattice part ( κ L) is in a good agreement with the glass thermal conductivity ~0.11 WK −1m −1 estimated by using the Cahill formula
